exercises.instruction: Complete each sentence with a/an or some + noun.

items.prompt: Complete: She’s looking for ___ to rent. (flat)
Complete: We need ___ for the cake. (egg)
Complete: He gave me ___ about the interview. (advice)
Complete: Let’s get ___ for the picnic. (sandwich)
Complete: I’m going to buy ___ today. (shoes)
Complete: She wants ___ for her birthday. (watch)
Emma works in a hospital and looks after patients. She/He is ____.
Gary cooks meals in a restaurant. She/He is ____.
Olena designs buildings and draws plans. She/He is ____.
Mark repairs cars in a garage. She/He is ____.
Sofia teaches children at a primary school. She/He is ____.
Danilo delivers letters and parcels. She/He is ____.
Nadia cuts hair in a salon. She/He is ____.
Ihor takes photos for a newspaper. She/He is ____.
I bought ____ at the market (not a lot).
____ is bad for your teeth (in general).
I talked to ____ after the meeting (a few).
There is ____ on the table (a little).
We’re going to buy ___ (fruit) after work.
They live in ___ (small town) near the sea.
We need ___ (new chairs) for the kitchen.
He wants ___ (new equipment) for the gym.

exercises.instruction: Complete with a/an and the. Write two words (e.g., a, the).

items.prompt: I saw ___ dog in the park. ___ dog followed me home. (Write: a/the)
She bought ___ umbrella. ___ umbrella was broken. (Write: an/the)
There was ___ email for you. ___ email was from HR. (Write: an/the)
We stayed in ___ hotel near the station. ___ hotel was noisy. (Write: a/the)

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct word: a, an or the.

items.prompt: I’m going to ___ supermarket. I need bread. (a/the)
I need ___ pen. Any pen is fine. (a/an)
She wants to buy ___ car (not a particular one). (a/the)
Where’s ___ charger? I can’t find it. (a/the)

exercises.instruction: Complete with a, an or the.

items.prompt: This is ___ first time I’ve been here. (a/an/the)
I’m looking for ___ apartment to rent. (a/an/the)
Can you pass me ___ salt, please? (a/an/the)
We had ___ great meal last night. (a/an/the)
I met ___ interesting person at the conference. (a/an/the)
Turn off ___ light in the kitchen, please. (a/an/the)
They live in ___ small village near the mountains. (a/an/the)
He wants to buy ___ new laptop. (a/an/the)
You see a chair in a room full of chairs. You say:
You are in a room and there is only one door. You say:
First time you mention a bike:
Second time you mention the same bike:
You mean a taxi you booked earlier:
You can identify it from context:
There is only one moon for Earth:
You mean any hotel, not a particular one:
We say: at ___ end of the month:
You and I both know which key:
Specific empty area (e.g., in a car park):
Look up — it’s cloudy. You’re looking at:
Outside the building (surface below your feet):
I heard it on ____ this morning.
He prefers going to ____ to watch plays.
Don’t believe everything you read on ____.
I opened ____ and got some fresh air.
Could you close ____? (we both see it)
We stayed in ____ near the beach.
____ we stayed in had a great view. (specific)
She is ____ person I told you about. (specific)
He bought ____ bike last week. (first mention)
____ bike he bought was very cheap. (second mention)
What’s ____ fastest way to get there?
Ellie is a student. Every day she goes to ____.
Ellie’s mother went to ____ to speak to a teacher.
As a student, she is at ____ now.
He’s studying and goes to ____ every weekday.
The protest was outside ____ in the city centre.
Children start ____ at the age of six.
We waited in front of ____ for an hour.
I was tired, so I went to ____ early.
I sat down on ____ to put on my shoes.
She’s still in ____ because she’s ill.
The cat jumped on ____ and fell asleep.
What time do you usually finish ____?
I don’t go out to work. I work ____.
He’s ____ today, so he can’t answer.
After the exam, we went to ____ to celebrate (students).
The taxi stopped in front of ____.
She made the bed and then sat on ____.
He went ____ and took a shower.

exercises.instruction: Choose the sentence that means ‘in general’.

options: The doctors are usually well paid.

exercises.instruction: Choose the sentence that means a general category.

options: I respect people who work hard.
I respect the people who work hard.
items.canonical: I respect people who work hard.
accepted_variants: I respect people who work hard.
I respect people who work hard
i respect people who work hard.
I respect people who work hard!
I respect people who work hard?

options: Do you like food with spicy sauce?
Do you like the food with spicy sauce?

do you like food with spicy sauce?
do you like food with spicy sauce?.

items.prompt: The place ‘Buckingham Palace’ normally uses the? actually no the. We'll keep no the.

Complete with pair / a pair / pairs.

items.prompt: I found a ____ of sunglasses in the car.
These ____ of trousers are too small.

exercises.instruction: Complete with a measurement adjective (use singular + hyphen).

items.prompt: They live in a ___ apartment. (2 rooms)
We met two ___. (12 years old girls)
I teach a class of ___. (16-year-old students)
